member.name: T:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidConsumerUsage
member.summary: Describes usages for the page.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidConsumerUsage.ConsumerControl
member.summary: General consumer control device.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidConsumerUsage.ACPan
member.summary: Set the horizontal offset of the display in the document.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage
member.summary: Describes usages for the page.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Pointer
member.summary: A collection of axes that generates a value to direct, indicate, or point user intentions to an application.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Mouse
member.summary: A hand-held, button-activated input device that when rolled along a flat surface, directs an indicator to move correspondingly about a computer screen, allowing the operator to move the indicator freely in select operations or to manipulate text or graphics.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Joystick
member.summary: A manual control or cursor device.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.GamePad
member.summary: A manual control or cursor device.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Keyboard
member.summary: The primary computer input device.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Keypad
member.summary: Any keyboard configuration that does not meet the minimum requirements of the Boot Keyboard.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.MultiAxisController
member.summary: An input device used to orient eyepoints and or objects in 3 dimensional space.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.X
member.summary: A linear translation in the X direction.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Y
member.summary: A linear translation in the Y direction.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Z
member.summary: A linear translation in the Z direction.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.RotationX
member.summary: A rotation about the X axis. Angular position report values follow the righthand rule.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.RotationY
member.summary: A rotation about the Y axis. Angular position report values follow the righthand rule.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.RotationZ
member.summary: A rotation about the Z axis. Angular position report values follow the righthand rule.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Slider
member.summary: A linear control for generating a variable value, normally in the form of a thumb slide in a slot.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Dial
member.summary: A rotary control for generating a variable value, normally in the form of a knob spun by the index finger and thumb.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Wheel
member.summary: A rotary control for generating a variable value, normally rolled, unlike a dial.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Hatswitch
member.summary: A specialized mechanical configuration of switches generating a variable value with a null state.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.CountedBuffer
member.summary: Used with buffered â€“byte data to indicate the number of valid bytes in the buffered-byte field.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.ByteCount
member.summary: Defines a report field that indicates the number of meaningful data bytes in an associated buffered-byte field.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.MotionWakeup
member.summary: Enables the generation of a USB remote wakeup when the device detects motion.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Start
member.summary: Session start button.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.Select
member.summary: Application option select button.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.VectorX
member.summary: A vector in the X direction.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.VectorY
member.summary: A vector in the Y direction.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.VectorZ
member.summary: A vector in the Z direction.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.VectorXBodyRelative
member.summary: A vector in the X direction relative to the body of an object.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.VectorYBodyRelative
member.summary: A vector in the Y direction relative to the body of an object.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.VectorZBodyRelative
member.summary: A vector in the Z direction relative to the body of an object.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.VectorNonOriented
member.summary: A non oriented vector or value.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemControl
member.summary: An application-level collection that contains system-software-specific usages.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemPowerDown
member.summary: Asserted when the intended action is to initiate system-wide power down now from Full Power or Sleep states.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemSleep
member.summary: Asserted when the intended action is to initiate system-wide low power mode now.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemWakeUp
member.summary: Asserted when the intended action is to initiate system-wide Full Power state now.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemContextMenu
member.summary: Evokes a context-sensitive menu.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemMainMenu
member.summary: Evokes the OS main-level selection menu.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemAppMenu
member.summary: Displays an application-specific menu.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemMenuHelp
member.summary: Displays the help menu.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemMenuExit
member.summary: Exits a menu.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemMenuSelect
member.summary: Selects a menu item.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemMenuRight
member.summary: Menu select right.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemMenuLeft
member.summary: Menu select left.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemMenuUp
member.summary: Menu select up.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.SystemMenuDown
member.summary: Menu select down.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.DPadUp
member.summary: Indicates that top of a Direction Pad is pressed.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.DPadDown
member.summary: Indicates that bottom of a Direction Pad is pressed

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.DPadRight
member.summary: Indicates that right side of a Direction Pad is pressed

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidGenericDesktopUsage.DPadLeft
member.summary: Indicates that left side of a Direction Pad is pressed

member.name: T:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidHelper
member.summary: Static class that provides helper functions for consuming HID input.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidHelper.TranslateJoystickAxis(OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage,System.Int32)
member.summary: Translates a generic HID usage value to a specific joystick axis for the specified .
member.returns: An that maps the HID usage value to a joystick axis.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage
member.summary: The usage page identifies both the intended usage and the measured values of a human interface device.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Undefined
member.summary: This page describes an undefined usage.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.GenericDesktop
member.summary: This page describes generic desktop controls.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Simulation
member.summary: This page provides detailed descriptions of the usages employed by simulation devices.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.VR
member.summary: Describes virtual reality controls. The usages depend on designators to identify the individual controls.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Sport
member.summary: This page describes sport controls.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Game
member.summary: This page describes game controls.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.GenericDevice
member.summary: This page provides usage definitions for controls that can be on any type of device.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.KeyboardOrKeypad
member.summary: This page is for key codes to be used in implementing a USB keyboard.
member.remarks: The usage type of all key codes is Selectors (Sel), except for the modifier keys 'Keyboard Left Control' (0x224) to 'Keyboard Right GUI' (0x231) which are Dynamic Flags (DV).

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.LEDs
F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Button
member.summary: This page describes a set of buttons which can be defined as Sel, OOC, MC or OSC depending on the context of their declaration.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Ordinal
member.summary: This page allows multiple instances of a control or sets of controls to be declared without requiring indiviual enumeration in the native usage page.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Telephony
member.summary: This page defines the keytop and control usages for telephony devices.
member.remarks: Note that in many cases usage definitions are intentionally vague, since it is assumed that the controls are interpreted by the telephone software application.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Consumer
member.summary: This page describes application-specific controls. They only affect a specific device, not the system as a whole.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Digitizer
member.summary: This section provides detailed descriptions of the usages employed by Digitizer Devices.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.PID
member.summary: Describes force feedback and related devices.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Unicode
member.summary: The Unicode page directly maps to the two-octet form defined in the Unicode Standard.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.AlphanumericDisplay
member.summary: The Alphanumeric display page is intended for use by simple alphanumeric displays that are used on consumer devices.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.MedicalInstruments
member.summary: This page provides usage definitions for medical instruments.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.PowerDevice
member.summary: Power device page.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.BatterySystem
member.summary: Battery system page.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.BarCodeScanner
member.summary: This page describes the USB Device Class definition for a bar code scanner ("Point of Sale" device).

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Scale
member.summary: This page describes the USB Device Class definition for a scale ("Point of Sale" device).

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.MagneticStripeReader
member.summary: This page describes the USB Device Class definition for a magnetic stripe reading device ("Point of Sale" device).

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.CameraControl
member.summary: This page describes the USB Device Class definition for "Image Class Devices".

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.Arcade
member.summary: This page describes the OAAF definitions for arcade and coinop related devices.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidPage.VendorDefinedStart
member.summary: Marks the beginning of vendor-defined usage pages.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage
member.summary: Describes usages for the page.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.FlightSimulationDevice
member.summary: This usage definition allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses the standard controls found on an airplane.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.AutomobileSimulationDevice
member.summary: This usage definition allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses the standard controls found in an automobile or truck.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.TankSimulationDevice
member.summary: This usage definition allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses standard controls found in a tank or a treaded vehicle.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.SpaceshipSimulationDevice
member.summary: This usage definition allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses standard controls found on a spaceship.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.SubmarineSimulationDevice
member.summary: Allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses the standard controls of a submarine.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.SailingSimulationDevice
member.summary: Allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses the standard controls of a sailboat.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.MotorcycleSimulationDevice
member.summary: Allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses the standard controls of a motorcycle.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.SportsSimulationDevice
member.summary: This usage definition allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses standard controls found on a sports simulation device.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.AirplaneSimulationDevice
member.summary: This usage definition allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses standard controls found on an airplane.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.HelicopterSimulationDevice
member.summary: This usage definition allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses standard controls found on a helicopter.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.MagicCarpetSimulationDevice
member.summary: Allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses the standard control of a magic carpet.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.BicycleSimulationDevice
member.summary: Allows a device to be generally classified as one that uses the standard controls of a bicycle.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.FlightControlStick
member.summary: A Flight Control Stick controls the Pitch and Roll of an airplane.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.FlightStick
member.summary: A Flight Stick defines a class of device commonly used for flight simulator games.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.CyclicControl
member.summary:
This control is specifically for a helicopter.
A cyclic control is a stick between the pilotâ€™s legs that moves in two axes.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.CyclicTrim
member.summary:
This control is specifically for a helicopter.
Cyclic Trim allows fine adjustment of the cyclic position in two dimensions.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.FlightYoke
member.summary: A flight yoke (also called a control wheel) controls the pitch and roll of an airplane.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.TrackControl
member.summary: A device for controlling the direction and velocity of a vehicle that is driven by tracks.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.Aileron
member.summary: An aileron is one of two movable flaps on the wings of an airplane that can be used to control the planeâ€™s rolling and banking movements.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.AileronTrim
member.summary: Allows fine adjustment of the Aileron position.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.AntiTorqueControl
member.summary: This control mechanically behaves the same as rudder pedals.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.AutopilotEnable
member.summary: This control enables or disables an airplaneâ€™s autopilot.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.ChaffRelease
member.summary: Chaff is used to reflect electromagnetic energy as a radar countermeasure.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.CollectiveControl
member.summary: This control is specifically for a helicopter. It controls the vertical acceleration or lift of the helicopter.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.DiveBrake
member.summary: A flap that can be extended on an aircraft to increase drag and reduce the speed of descent.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.ElectronicCountermeasures
member.summary: A pushbutton that enables electronic countermeasures.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.Elevator
member.summary: A movable control surface, usually attached to the horizontal stabilizer of an aircraft, that is used to produce motion up or down.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.ElevatorTrim
member.summary: Elevator Trim allows fine adjustment of the Elevator position.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.Rudder
member.summary: The zero position is centered, positive values turn right, and negative values turn left.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.Throttle
member.summary: A valve that regulates the flow of a fluid, such as the valve in an internal-combustion engine that controls the amount of vaporized fuel entering the cylinders.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.FlightCommunications
member.summary: Typically this is a two-position pushbutton where the first position enables communications with the crew and the second position enables the transmitter for communication external to the plane.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.FlareRelease
member.summary: A flare is a device that produces a bright light for signaling, illumination, identification, or heat for infrared missile countermeasures.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.LandingGear
member.summary: A control for raising or lowering an airplaneâ€™s landing gear.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.ToeBrake
member.summary: A device for slowing or stopping the motion of an airplane when it is on the ground.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.Trigger
member.summary: A lever pressed by the finger to release or activate a mechanism, typically used to discharge a firearm.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.WeaponsArm
member.summary: This device is normally a covered toggle switch that must be selected to enable the weapons system.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.WeaponsSelect
member.summary: This device can either be a pushbutton that steps through the available weapons or a radio button that selects them individually.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.WingFlaps
member.summary: Wing flap controls are usually powered either hydraulically or by electric motors, and are used for low-speed control of an airplane.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.Accelerator
member.summary: A device, especially the gas pedal of a motor vehicle, for increasing speed.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.Brake
member.summary: A device for slowing or stopping motion, as of a vehicle, especially by contact friction.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.Clutch
member.summary: A device for disengaging the transmission of a vehicle to allow shifting of gears.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.Shifter
member.summary: A device for shifting gears in a vehicle.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.Steering
member.summary: A steering wheel is a single degree-of-freedom device that rotates about an axis.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.TurretDirection
member.summary: This control determines the right-to-left positioning of the tank turret.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.BarrelElevation
member.summary: This control determines the elevation of the gun barrel in a turret.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.DivePlane
member.summary: Dive planes control the vertical ascent or descent of the submarine under power.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.Ballast
member.summary: Ballast controls the vertical ascent or descent of the submarine.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.BicycleCrank
member.summary: A foot-operated assembly of pedals attached to a crank that is used for powering a bicycle.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.HandleBars
member.summary: A steering control, held in both hands, for a motorcycle or bicycle.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.FrontBrake
member.summary: Engages the front brake of the motorcycle to slow the vehicle.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Input.Hid.HidSimulationUsage.RearBrake
member.summary: Engages the rear brake of the motorcycle to slow the vehicle.
